summary: Not sure if this has been asked but besides Sansa who’s your favorite GOT female character? Who’s your favorite GOT male...
question: Not sure if this has been asked but besides Sansa who’s your favorite GOT female character? Who’s your favorite GOT male character? Are you excited for the final season ending for your favorite characters including Sansa if they’re alive? Thoughts? Thx.
answer:
GoT only or ASOIAF? I’ll go with GoT.

Favourite female characters:

  1. Sansa Stark
  2. Cersei Lannister
  3. Catelyn Stark
  4. I like Shae a lot too

Favourite male characters:

  1. Theon Greyjoy
  2. Stannis Baratheon
  3. Doran Martell
  4. Bran Stark

I am excited for the ending because I’m 100% sure Sansa and Bran are surviving but I’m convinced Cersei will get a horrible storyline. If Theon dies for Yara I’ll fight D&D with my bare hands. 

Honestly most of my excitement is seeing theories I support validated (Dark Dany, Dance of Dragons 2.0, Queen Sansa) but I can already tell there’ll be garbage than I can stand so it’s a mixed bag for me

tags: big thanks to everyone i know for putting up with my terrible theories
summary: Kit Harington ended his SNL monologue by yelling “Tyrion is the Night King,” which was obviously a joke.  This is homage to the...
body: Kit Harington ended his SNL monologue by yelling “Tyrion is the Night King,” which was obviously a joke.  This is homage to the popular “Bran is the Night King” theory.  Kit appears to have picked Tyrion to name drop as a humorously unlikely candidate to be the Night King.  However, by extension of the fact that he didn’t make the joke about Bran, we can extrapolate that the concept of Bran = Night King isn’t off the table.  In fact, Kit probably isn’t allowed to say any actual spoilers, even as jokes, so the actual theory seems more likely given that Kit is skirting around it.  In this essay I will go absolutely crazy while waiting for season 8 to start.

summary: So this song could either be the very obvious story of someone changing into a white walker and begging for help OR it could be...
body:
Cold Cold Cold - Cage the Elephant

So this song could either be the very obvious story of someone changing into a white walker and begging for help OR it could be someone falling to the ‘dark side’ and desperately reaching out before they truly turn. If the second is correct there’s two likely possibilities: Bran or Daenerys.

Bran seems to have become more emotionless or ‘cold’ after taking on the role of the Three Eyed Raven, for example he let Meera leave without any gratitude or affection and made Sansa relive the traumatic memory of her wedding. If this is really the case, he could be tempted to do something that would make sense logically but would have negative emotional consequences and therefore this is his internal debate with his last slice of humanity. If you believe the Bran=Night King theory then this song works nicely for it: ‘and as the darkness falls, it fills up both my eyes… with my arms open wide’.

If it’s about Dany, this could suggest the Mad Queen theory or at least the idea of it. She’s has the most advisors and maybe after discovering the truth of Jons parentage and viewing him as a legitimate threat for the first time, she is confronting her advisors about what she should do. Tyrion as the ‘Doctor’ because he’s good at fixing things, Jorah as her ‘Counsellor’ and Missandei was the ‘Sweet Nurse’. She asks Missandei not to ‘look at me that way/I’ve seen those eyes before’ because she’s afraid of her betraying her like Dorreah did.

summary: What if Bran didn’t get a personality lobotomy when he became the Three Eyes Raven? What if he just shut down because of what...
body: What if Bran didn’t get a personality lobotomy when he became the Three Eyes Raven? What if he just shut down because of what happened to Hodor and the part he played in it? Hopefully that means with some time and good deeds he’ll come back to himself a bit? I sure hope so, because I miss him!

summary: @omgellendean pointed out Brienne’s leather jerkin in the first day on set video is very much like Ned’s, it’s even a similar...
body: @omgellendean pointed out Brienne’s leather jerkin in the first day on set video is very much like Ned’s, it’s even a similar colour, just the shoulders look shorter maybe, actually like Bran’s in that way (I think maybe Ned’s is laced in the opposite direction in this shot for some reason? I’ve seen others which aren’t).

summary: Sansa’s and Bran’s Journeys
title: Sansa’s and Bran’s Journeys
body:
HBO’s official GoT website, http://www.makinggameofthrones.com, has featured retrospective summaries of some of the series’ main character arcs: Arya Stark, Jon Snow, Cersei Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, and Daenerys Targaryen. These summaries of the primary fan fave characters have been available for a few months, and I’ve been waiting - so far in vain - to see the official summaries of Sansa’s and Bran’s arcs. So far, nothing, and we’re only 2 days away from the season premiere.

I find it hard to believe that’s because these two characters “aren’t important,” and so we’re not going to get summaries for their stories. I doubt that the team that runs the website simply forgot to upload them. I suspect that we’re going to see them in the next week or two, once the final season is underway, and that the reason for the delayed release is because the summaries will make it clear that Bran and Sansa - often overlooked and/or dismissed by large portions of the audience - are the unlikely heroes of the story.

summary: But think about it Bran is able to interact with the past as if he is there even though nobody can see him. He called out to his...
question: But think about it Bran is able to interact with the past as if he is there even though nobody can see him. He called out to his father at the tower of joy and Ned heard him. He warged into young Hodor linking him to present hodor dying. Bran may not have manifested into a physical form but imagine if he warged into a person to try and negotiate with the children of forest but they captured him and turned him into the night king. I also think he is responsible for the wall being built
answer:
My problem with this theory is - If Bran went back in time and skinchanged into the man who became the Night King, how is there any Bran left to go back again, to skinchange into Bran the Builder and influence him to build a Wall?

And this might just be me, but it feels a little anticlimactic for Bran to go back into the past to influence someone to build a Wall that we already see gets knocked down. It’s possible, I suppose, but we already know it’s just a temporary solution.

When it comes to Hodor, I think we’re supposed to be wildly uncomfortable with Bran skinchanging into him. It feels wrong, especially to Hodor but to the reader, too. To me, it feels wrong if Bran is supposed to invade the mind of something to save the world.

One theory I love is that Bran accidentally skinchanged into (the likewise fragile-minded) King Aerys somewhere along his time traveling journey, and that’s why the Mad King was chanting, Hodor-style, “Burn them all!”

Just like Hodor hearing Meera’s plea to “Hold the door”, Aerys might’ve heard instructions to burn wights (or maybe weirwood trees?), descending into a madness that caused his murder by Jaime Lannister - who interpreted it, instead, as an instruction to burn the citizens of King’s Landing.

If that turns out to be true, then Bran skinchanging into another person without their consent caused more harm than good a second time. Still assuming that’s what happened, then the third time resulted in the most powerful ‘monster’ Westeros has ever known.

Either way, I must admit I’m not the biggest fan of “Bran = The Night King”. I’m a bigger fan of Bran being kin to the Night King and ultimately helping him (or healing him).

My best guess is that whatever wildcard Bran might be holding will be much more “down to earth” than we expect.

reblog.comment:
My problem with this theory is - If Bran went back in time and skinchanged into the man who became the Night King, how is there any Bran left to go back again, to skinchange into Bran the Builder and influence him to build a Wall?

And this might just be me, but it feels a little anticlimactic for Bran to go back into the past to influence someone to build a Wall that we already see gets knocked down. It’s possible, I suppose, but we already know it’s just a temporary solution.

When it comes to Hodor, I think we’re supposed to be wildly uncomfortable with Bran skinchanging into him. It feels wrong, especially to Hodor but to the reader, too. To me, it feels wrong if Bran is supposed to invade the mind of something to save the world.

One theory I love is that Bran accidentally skinchanged into (the likewise fragile-minded) King Aerys somewhere along his time traveling journey, and that’s why the Mad King was chanting, Hodor-style, “Burn them all!”

Just like Hodor hearing Meera’s plea to “Hold the door”, Aerys might’ve heard instructions to burn wights (or maybe weirwood trees?), descending into a madness that caused his murder by Jaime Lannister - who interpreted it, instead, as an instruction to burn the citizens of King’s Landing.

If that turns out to be true, then Bran skinchanging into another person without their consent caused more harm than good a second time. Still assuming that’s what happened, then the third time resulted in the most powerful ‘monster’ Westeros has ever known.

Either way, I must admit I’m not the biggest fan of “Bran = The Night King”. I’m a bigger fan of Bran being kin to the Night King and ultimately helping him (or healing him).

My best guess is that whatever wildcard Bran might be holding will be much more “down to earth” than we expect.
